intro: Echites bispinosus, commonly known as the two-spined echites, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
